text: For the CTA modules, alot of the times we are using custom css to style them. However, when you are viewing them in the CTA area with a "link (no style)" setting, you cant see any css classes that was applied.
Thanks for the feedback, AJ. Do you include the style within the CTA custom CSS section itself or inside the overall CSS file for the website?
inside the css file for the website

Gotcha, I understand. That's a tricky problem to solve since CTAs are siloed assets at the moment, they're agnostic of HubSpot CMS vs outside CMS. We're definitely looking to rework a lot of this though so stay tuned :slightly_smiling_face:
would you be able to do something like a preview button similar to the way you preview design manager templates
then again that may skew views on the CTA then if done...
un;ess you can pass in the css file to this iframe that is used for the preview of the cta: `<https://static.hsappstatic.net/CtaUI/static-1.2611/html/preview.html#app.HubSpot.com>`
